alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights) (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 4:23PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Chesterfield and northeastern Dinwiddie Counties through 500 PM EST... At 422 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dinwiddie, moving north at 30 mph. This storm has been exhibiting rotation but recently appears to be weakening. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dinwiddie, Matoaca, Sutherland, Petersburg Airport and Addison. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for central and south central Virginia.
